record.title: AUTHORIZING THE USE OF THE ROTUNDA AND GROUNDS OF THE CAPITOL
record.narrative:
AUTHORIZING THE USE OF THE ROTUNDA AND GROUNDS OF THE CAPITOL -- (Senate - September 05, 2007)

[Page: S11125]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H. Con. Res. 196, just received from the House and at the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report the concurrent resolution by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

A concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 196) authorizing the use of the Rotunda and grounds of the Capitol for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold Medal to Tenzin Gyatso, the Fourteenth Dalai Lama.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the concurrent resolution.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the concurrent resolution be agreed to and the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, without intervening action or debate.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 196) was agreed to.
